name: Norfolk Royale Hotel

reviews.text: This was our second vist to the Norfolk Royal.
reviews.title: A comfortable hotel, but could be better

reviews.text: My wife and I booked the hotel as part of a special offer so all in all we had good value for money.
reviews.title: Very Mixed

reviews.text: However we would suggest that the normal daily rate is excessive.
reviews.title: Overall, a great hotel

reviews.text: The Good Points
reviews.title: Pleasant stay, nice rooms, service could be better

reviews.text: The hotel is situated close to the shopping area and park and is approximately five minutes walk from the pier.
reviews.title: Had a really great break hope to return soon
Not quite fawlty towers
reviews.text: Came here as part of a large group. Staff were friendly and the receptionist was really kind to our children. The restaurant staff need far more training as the service was very definitely not silver service. Breakfast was a disappointment......even at a premier inn you get to order your hot food. Position was lovely and central but this did also mean noisy at times. Parking was so difficult it meant that we were frightened to go out in case we lost the space! Again £12 is very steep for what is not a secure car park. We would come again but on a cheap deal. 3 star standard ........ Just.

reviews.title: Could be lovely hotel staff let it down and noisey area
reviews.text: This could be a lovely place but! Staff let it down and the noise coming from club across road and loud drunks didn't sleep for the three nights we stayed there room and bath room dirty bathroom three star not four blood stained nets bad beds and food terrible staff ignore complaints and some are rude pool area filthy never paid to park i'n hotel car park before 12 pound a night lift i's terrible so slow cold unwelcoming ignore guests if u complain and the response s on here to people complaining say it all rude and there just not bothered what u think u can find lot better for the money over rated big time

reviews.title: Fawlty Towers ! Just DONT GO HEREFilthy dirty and got food poisoningComical lack of customer service
reviews.text: The worst food and scruffy noisy rooms.

reviews.title: Do not believe the bad reviews
reviews.text: Awful customer service

reviews.title: Paying a lot guarantees you nothing, (at the Norfolk Royale Bournemouth).
reviews.text: If there was a competition for a fawlty towers experience this place would be in with a good shout of winning

Excellent location near the beach, pier, gardens, theatres and nightlife. Large elegant rooms very clean and well maintained. Friendly staff. Nice indoor pool lovely gardens to the rear. Downside - car park is expensive.
reviews.title: Worth paying a little extra

reviews.text: The good thing about staying in the Norfolk is the convenience it offers in terms of its proximity to shopping centers, pubs and other hangouts.
reviews.title: Coveniently located in the heart of a small town

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here for about 5 days. The rooms were clean and the beds were comfortable.
reviews.title: Overall a very nice and relaxing stay but can understand the complaints of previous reviewers.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Most hotels in Bournemouth offer Bed & Breakfast. The Breakfast menu here too was nothing lavish and didnt change much over the course of my stay.
reviews.title: Terribly disappointed by this dreadful 4* hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: What I understood was that there are a very few good hotels within the town. So, If the idea is to roam around the small town, then this is the place to stay. Would otherwise recommend hotels by the Sea.
reviews.title: Fabulous Hotel - would definitely visit again!
Could do better, but overall not a bad hotel
reviews.text: We stayed at the Norfolk Royale after reading good reviews of the hotel. The hotel itself was nice and the staff were very friendly and welcoming. I wouldn't pay for the parking though as it is £12 and you can around the corner for free!

reviews.title: perfect for a weekend break - amazing food!
reviews.text: Our room was clean and comfortable but nowhere near as modern and slick as I was expecting from the website. The spa facilities are small and clean and better suited to a young family rather than a young (ish) couple looking to relax. Breakfast was good but could have done with a better fresh fruit selection if im being fussy.

reviews.title: Worst hotel ever - Just avoid it
reviews.text: The only thing I did find let the experience down was the smell on our floor in the corridor, I don't know if the windows went over the kitchen but in the corridor the smell of curry was overpowering and really put a damper on the weekend. Having stayed in another 4 star hotel the weekend before I felt the hotel was slightly on the pricey side for what was delivered and could do more to be a real 4 star hotel.

reviews.title: The warmest welcome I have ever received
reviews.text: I will certainly return to the Norfolk Royale - perfect central location for a break in Bournemouth...easy walking distance to the pier and seafront.

reviews.title: Excellent hotel in the heart of Bournemouth
reviews.text: We had dinner included in a our package on both nights and I was amazed at the excellent quality of the food and the presention. Really high standard. The restaurant, bar and reception staff were all very helpful and were happy to provide maps, directions and any information needed about Bournemouth. We used the hotel leisure facilities on the first day, ok but bit basic. However you also get access to the pool and spa at Meryck Park Golf club - about 15mins walk away.....these were excellent and worth the visit there.

description: Bournemouth's premier AA four-star hotel, The Norfolk is Ideally positioned within a short stroll of the resort's major attractions - including its award winning gardens and golden sand Blue Flag beaches.Originally converted from two imposing Edwardian villas, The Norfolk Hotel today boasts 95 spacious and thoughtfully-equipped en suite guestrooms. The Norfolk Hotel's lounge and bar provide the ideal setting to relax and enjoy morning coffee, a new and innovative range of afternoon teas, or evening cocktails.Recently-introduced Friday Fizz events invite guests and non-residents alike to celebrate the start of the weekend with sparkling wines and Champagnes at half price between 4pm and 8pm.The lounge opens on to The Norfolk Hotel's impressive Art Deco verandah which, along with the hotel's secluded gardens alow visitors to eat, drink and be merry al fresco The gardens are also the Venue for The Norfolk Hotel's summer barbecue season which runs from May through September. From noon to 9pm, guests can lunch or dine in the summer sun or when the weather refuses to co-operate move into Echoes, the hotel's fine-sining restaurant. Guest facilites also include a glass-roofed heated indoor pool, whirlpool, steam room and sauna, while the Orchid Rooms Beauty Salon offers a wide range of beauty, holistic and clinical therapy treatments in a quiet and relaxed environment.
